ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] More women playing EQ lately?
ygData.msgSnippet: I often have a hard time remembering that my characters are female when I m playing them. And I often have people ask me if I m a guy playing a girl. It s
ygData.messageBody:
I often have a hard time remembering that my characters are female when I'm
playing them. And I often have people ask me if I'm a guy playing a girl.
It's rather amusing.
luv,
-Su


>
> I have both male and Female characters, mostly female but the only reason
for me was for a bit of variety because all my characters are high elves,
and because I usually play with all 4 main chars at once, (works out real
good when u can control a cleric, druid, mage and a warrior yourself i.e. no
idiots getting you killed because they don't know what to do when everything
goes to buggery, even on my 56K freeserve connection (which surprised the
hell outta me thats for sure) but I digress, the only reason I use both male
and female models is as I said because I play high elves and since most
races are limited to a handful of different models male/female it can get
hard to make them look completely different from each other especially if
they are all wearing the same kind of gear like DRT's and leather, robes
etc. Although I find playing a character that is the same sex as me is
easier since I don't have to keep reminding myself what sex my char is.
>
> Nuada (KIA)
>
> 24th Season Elven Mage
>
> Druzil Ro
>
